title:
Next-Generation Satellite IoT Networks: A HAPS-Enabled Solution to
  Enhance Optical Data Transfer
authors:
Ethan Fettes, Pablo G. Madoery, Halim Yanikomeroglu, Gunes Karabulut
  Kurt, Colin Bellinger, St\'ephane Martel, Khaled Ahmed, Sameera Siddiqui
abstract:
For decades, satellites have facilitated remote internet of things (IoT)
services. However, the recent proliferation of increasingly capable sensors and
a surge in the number deployed, has led to a substantial growth in the volume
of data that needs to be transmitted via satellites. In response to this
growing demand, free space optical communication systems have been proposed, as
they allow for the use of large bandwidths of unlicensed spectrum, enabling
high data rates. However, optical communications are highly vulnerable to
weather-induced disruptions, thereby limiting their high potential. This paper
proposes the use of high altitude platform station (HAPS) systems in
conjunction with delay-tolerant networking techniques to increase the amount of
data that can be transmitted to the ground from satellites when compared to the
use of traditional ground station network architectures. The architectural
proposal is evaluated in terms of delivery ratio and buffer occupancy, and the
subsequent discussion analyzes the advantages, challenges and potential areas
for future research.
